### Tender Announcement: Stream to Sea Program Delivery and Coordination Services

#### Solicitation Information

* **Reference Number**: PW-22-01004374
* **Solicitation Number**: 30003165
* **Publication Date**: August 16, 2022
* **Tender Closing Date**: August 31, 2022 at 1:00 PM (ET)
* **Contracting Entity**: Fisheries and Oceans Canada
* **Procurement Category**: Service-Related (SRV)

#### Tender Description

Fisheries and Oceans Canada is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the Stream to Sea Program Delivery and Coordination Services. This program aims to develop opportunities for external parties to be involved in the conservation and management of salmon resources.

The successful contractor will be responsible for providing delivery and coordination services for the Stream to Sea Program across the school year, as defined by the Community Advisor. The services will include:

* Coordinating and assisting with the set up of classroom incubators (aquaria)
* Delivering salmon eggs to schools and providing classroom sessions on salmon life cycle, fish dissections, aquatic ecosystems, and habitat requirements for salmon
* Providing trouble shooting and maintenance support for aquaria in schools
* Developing or assisting with the development and delivery of a spring fry release program for participating schools

In some instances, the contractor may be required to participate in the live transport of adult and juvenile salmon and may participate in the spawning of broodstock.

#### Key Requirements

* Must be able to work independently and as part of a team
* Must have strong communication and problem-solving skills
* Must be able to work with Community Advisors, teachers, and other stakeholders to deliver the program
* Must be able to develop and implement a spring fry release program for participating schools

#### Evaluation Criteria

The RFP will be evaluated based on the contractor's experience and qualifications in delivering similar programs. The evaluation will be conducted on a best-value basis.
